column4: would anyone know how I could take the soundcard output and stream it over shoutcast or something? I am using VNC for remote desktop but this has no sound, and i was looking for a way to stream sound over the internet using another application to go along with vnc.
shoutcast could work ... but why would you pipe system sounds?
ahh, then you can use shoutcast with the ability to stream wav
but from what i see, i can only select a playlist of soundfiles to stream
shoutcast allows you to configure a directory and then it creates a playlist based in the directory
check the config file, also, make sure the directory ends with a slash :)
why are you editing sound remotely though?
well what directory would i choose to be able to send system sounds?
no idea, afaik, there is nothing that can pipe /dev/dsp over network ...

i use thin clients connecting at various places between the house, connecting to instruments, etc. It would also be useful to just be able to hear sound without having to find the file and stream it over to my thin client
its hard to explain without it sounding strange
sorry, I don't know how to achieve what you want. I understand what you are saying ...
i don't know much about the linux sound system, what is /dev/dsp?
why did it matter if i was running alsa or oss?
